Upcoming Workshops

Winter 2026

Our workshops are held outdoors, in all weather. Pricing, format, and location vary by workshop and by teacher. Click on a workshop below to find out more!

Greater Boston

A Gentle Introduction to Off-Grid Power

Learn the basics of making, storing and using electrical energy at home - for kids and adults. (Image: Taufik 2022)
February 2026
Greater Boston

Easy Off-Grid Mesh Radio

Introduction to local radio construction and use

Here are some workshops we've held recently. Click to see photos and details from each event!

Waltham, MA

Waltham Fields Community Farm: Farm Day 2025

Hands-on solar demos, hand drills, and DIY fun at Waltham Fields Community Farm

Ideas for Future Workshops

Farming Gardening Water Collection Water Filtering Water Testing Shelter Radio Electronics STEM Arts & Crafts Woodworking Metalworking

Below are some workshops we are considering offering soon. If you'd be interested to attend (or teach!) any of them -- or have an idea for another workshop! -- please let us know at info@waterbearfieldschool.org.

Bicycle Mechanics Basics

Learn essential bike maintenance and repair skills for keeping your bicycle in top condition

Building a Cob Oven

Build an outdoor clay oven for baking bread, pizza, and more using ancient techniques. (Image: Wikipedia)

Building a DIY 4G Phone

Build your own open-source mobile phone with calls, texts, and only the features you choose

DIY Air Filtration

Build your own affordable, effective air purifier using the Corsi-Rosenthal box design

DIY Bike Trailers

Build a low-cost cargo bike trailer from readily-available hardware store materials

DIY CO2 Monitoring

Building a low-cost DIY CO2 monitor with graphing and local storage

Intro to Sandcasting

Learn the ancient art of casting metal objects using sand molds. (Image: Wikipedia)

Introduction to Welding

Learn basic welding skills while creating a musical Butaphone instrument from a gas bottle

Making Biochar Water Filters

Build a low-cost water filtration system using locally-produced biochar. (Image: Kearns et al, 2023)

Off-Grid Water Level Monitoring

Build solar-powered sensors to track water levels in wells, streams, and tanks
